text.p: True or False: If [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] is a [mathjaxinline]6\times 4[/mathjaxinline] matrix whose columns are linearly independent, and [mathjaxinline]Au = Av[/mathjaxinline] for vectors [mathjaxinline]u,v \in \mathbb R^4[/mathjaxinline], then [mathjaxinline]u=v[/mathjaxinline].

font.p: Let [mathjaxinline]Au = Av = w[/mathjaxinline]. Since the columns of [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] are linearly independent, the equation [mathjaxinline]Ax = w[/mathjaxinline] can have at most one solution. Since [mathjaxinline]u[/mathjaxinline] and [mathjaxinline]v[/mathjaxinline] are both solutions to this equation, they must be equal.
